intro: Dontostemon brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed morning glory, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are slender and twining. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
